column4: I am having an issue on boot, it hangs for approximately 145 seconds, at about 1.57 seconds in on my dmesg log. I think it pertains to ACPI and APIC issues. Here is a dmesg log of a boot, that hangs, with ACPI APIC enabled in my bios http://goo.gl/ioygb -- here is a dmesg log with ACPI APIC disabled in my BIOS, but without the hang: http://goo.gl/ecXLI
Disabling ACPI and/or APIC is hardly an ideal solution, to lose power management or reduce myself from 6 cores to 1 core available
I've tried 2 different BIOS revisions, I'm attempting to contact ASUS as we speak, the previous livechat rep left mid-conversation
the latest BIOS may have an APCP / APIC fix
are there bugs logged for your kernel against the motherboard you have?
I've found http://goo.gl/ArwRq but it doesn't seem to be helpful. Should I append that bug, or file my own? It does (mostly) match the description
you could log your own, if the admins determine it's a duplicate they willmark it as such. You can start the ball rolling with:   ubuntu-bug acpi
Where would I file it? Here? https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/natty
easiest way is to use your backups
